alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Dawson; Franklin; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:16AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, western Webster, Phelps, western Adams, Kearney, southern Buffalo, southeastern Dawson and Harlan Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler Radar and automated weather stations reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Overton to Holdrege to near Woodruff. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Doppler Radar and Automated Weather Stations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kearney, Holdrege, Minden, Gibbon, Alma, Franklin, Elm Creek, Kenesaw, Axtell, Overton, Odessa, Orleans, Loomis, Hildreth, Wilcox, Campbell, Bladen, Roseland, Holstein and Funk. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 248 and 292. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Dawson; Franklin; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps; Webster
